source.name: LAN's
source.instructions: Select the correct answer from the available list
source.text: A <<<LAN>>> allows computers on a single <<<SITE>>> to communicate with each other and share resources. Separate <<<LANs>>> can be connected together to form a <<<WAN>>>. The <<<internet>>> is an example of this type of network.

source.name: Client Server
source.instructions: Select the correct answer from the available list
source.text: A <<<client-server>>> network is controlled by a <<<server>>> which controls <<<access>>> to the network. It is also responsible for <<<storing>>> the files created by the users.

text: to the network. It is also responsible for
the files created by the users.

source.name: Peer to Peer Networks
source.instructions: Select the correct answer from the available list
source.text: In a <<<peer-to-peer>>> network all of the computers are equal and give other users <<<access>>> to their resources such as hard disk drives and connected computers.

text: network all of the computers are equal and give other users
to their resources such as hard disk drives and connected computers.

source.name: Client-Server Network
source.instructions: Select correct answer from the available list
source.text: In a <<<client-server-network>>> all of the data can be backed up centrally but in a <<<peer-to-peer>>> network each machine is responsible its own backup.
